intro: Epilobium madrense, commonly known as Madreño willow herb, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium madrense typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine in some regions.
